snippet: General Motors and Chrysler reported double-digit sales of new vehicles, while Ford’s rose 7 percent. Toyota sales were up 60 percent.
abstract: Auto industry surpasses expectations in June, reporting a 22 percent increase in sales, fueled in large part by lower gas prices and a surge of interest in new car models.
lead_paragraph: General Motors and Chrysler reported double-digit sales of new vehicles, while Ford’s rose 7 percent. Toyota sales were up 60 percent.

headline.seo: U.S. Car Sales Climbed in June
headline.main: Lower Gas Prices and New Models Sent Vehicle Sales Higher in June
headline.print_headline: Lower Gas Prices and New Models Sent Vehicle Sales Higher in June
